Thread: 3 underrated Chrome Extension APIs that most developers miss
Feb 14
Dev Expert @devexpert
1/ chrome.scripting.executeScript lets you inject code dynamically. Way more flexible than static content scripts.
Web Dev Fan @webdevfan
Great tip! I use this for my dark mode extension.
Dev Expert @devexpert
2/ chrome.declarativeNetRequest is the MV3 replacement for webRequest. Much faster, no background page needed.
Browser Hacker @browserhacker
The migration from webRequest to declarativeNetRequest was painful but worth it.
Extension Dev @extensiondev
Bookmarking this thread for later reference.
Dev Expert @devexpert
3/ chrome.sidePanel is new in MV3. Opens a persistent side panel - perfect for tools and dashboards.
